Bases: Form

Form for user registration.

Parameters:

  • username (django.forms.CharField) – CharField for username with validation on length and widget for styling.

  • email (django.forms.EmailField) – EmailField for email with validation on length and widget for styling.

  • password1 (django.forms.CharField) – CharField for password with validation on length and widget for password input.

  • password2 (django.forms.CharField) – CharField for confirming password with validation on length and widget for password input.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

objects = <django.db.models.manager.Manager object>
products

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

items

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

Bases: Model

Represents an item in an order.

This model stores information about a specific product included in an order, including its price and quantity.

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Saves the product instance.

This method automatically generates a slug from the product name if one doesn’t exist.
